## AWSQuickSetupType-EnableConfigRecording

### What does this document do?

The **AWSQuickSetupType-EnableConfigRecording** automation document starts a new configuration recording, or updates the existing configuration recording of selected resources, in your AWS account.

### Inputs

- **ResourceTypes**: (Optional) A comma-separated list that specifies the types of AWS resources for which AWS Config records configuration changes (for example, AWS::EC2::Instance or AWS::CloudTrail::Trail).
- **RecordGlobalResourceTypes**: (Optional) Specifies whether AWS Config includes all supported types of global resources (for example, IAM resources) with the resources that it records.
- **RecorderUpdateStrategy**: (Optional) When set to _FAIL_, the document execution will terminate with a failure if an existing configuration recorder has been detected. When set to _NO\_OP_, the update of the existing configuration recorder will be skipped. When set to _MERGE_, current recorder settings are maintained and specified resources are added to the list of AWS resources to be recorded. When set to _OVERWRITE_, current recorder settings will be replaced with provided values.
- **DeliveryChannelS3BucketName**: (Required) The name of the Amazon S3 bucket to which AWS Config delivers configuration snapshots and configuration history files. This parameter is required if there is no delivery channel set up in the current region.
- **DeliveryChannelS3KeyPrefix**: (Optional) The name of the Amazon S3 folder to which AWS Config delivers configuration snapshots and configuration history files.
- **DeliveryChannelSNSTopicName**: (Optional) The Name of the Amazon SNS topic to which AWS Config sends notifications about configuration changes. Note: Both DeliveryChannelSNSTopicName and DeliveryChannelSNSTopicAccountID must be provided to use a custom SNS topic. If only one is provided, a default topic will be created instead.
- **DeliveryChannelSNSTopicAccountID**: (Optional) The Account ID of the Amazon SNS topic to which AWS Config sends notifications about configuration changes. Note: Both DeliveryChannelSNSTopicName and DeliveryChannelSNSTopicAccountID must be provided to use a custom SNS topic. If only one is provided, a default topic will be created instead.
- **StreamConfigurationChangesToSNS**: (Optional) When set to true, AWS Config streams configuration changes and notifications to an Amazon SNS topic.
- **DeliveryChannelDeliveryFrequency**: (Optional) The frequency with which AWS Config delivers configuration snapshots.
- **DeliveryChannelUpdateStrategy**: (Optional) When set to _FAIL_, the document execution will terminate with a failure if an existing delivery channel has been detected. When set to _NO\_OP_, the update of the existing delivery channel will be skipped. When set to _OVERWRITE_, current delivery channel settings will be replaced with provided values.
- **AutomationAssumeRole**: (Required) The ARN of the role that allows Systems Manager Automation to perform actions on your behalf.

### Outputs

- **ConfigurationRecorderName**: The name of the created or updated configuration recorder.
- **DeliveryChannelName**: The name of the created or updated delivery channel.

DeliveryChannelS3KeyPrefix.description: (Optional) The key prefix in the S3 bucket you want AWS Config configuration snapshots and configuration history files to be stored in.

AutomationAssumeRole.description: (Required) The ARN of the role that allows Systems Manager Automation to perform actions on your behalf.

ResourceTypes.description: (Optional) A comma-separated list that specifies the types of AWS resources for which AWS Config records configuration changes (for example, AWS::EC2::Instance or AWS::CloudTrail::Trail).

DeliveryChannelDeliveryFrequency.description: (Optional) The frequency with which AWS Config delivers configuration snapshots.

GlobalResourceTypesRegion.description: (Optional) Specifies the Region where global resources are recorded.

RecorderUpdateStrategy.description: (Optional) If you specify _FAIL_, the automation ends with an execution status of failed if an existing configuration recorder is detected. If you specify _NO\_OP_, no changes are made to the existing recorder. If you specify _MERGE_, the existing recorder settings arent changed and any additional resources you specify in the values for this automation are added to the list of resources to record. If you specify _OVERWRITE_, existing configuration recorder settings are replaced with the values you specify for this automation.

StreamConfigurationChangesToSNS.description: (Optional) When set to true, AWS Config streams configuration changes and notifications to an Amazon SNS topic.

DeliveryChannelSNSTopicName.description: (Optional) The name of the Amazon SNS topic you want AWS Config to send notifications about configuration changes to.

RecordGlobalResourceTypes.description: (Optional) Specifies whether AWS Config includes all supported types of global resources (for example, IAM resources) with the resources that it records.

DeliveryChannelS3BucketName.description: (Optional) The name of the Amazon S3 bucket AWS Config sends configuration snapshots and configuration history files to. This parameter is required if there is no deliver channel set up in the current Region.

DeliveryChannelUpdateStrategy.description: (Optional) If you specify _FAIL_, the automation ends with an execution status of failed if an existing delivery channel is detected. If you specify _NO\_OP_, no changes are made to the existing delivery channel. If you specify _OVERWRITE_, existing delivery channel settings are replaced with the values you specify for this automation.

DeliveryChannelSNSTopicAccountID.description: (Optional) The ID of the account where the SNS topic resides that you want AWS Config to send notifications about configuration changes to.
